author: larryi
msg: Added support for Context virtual host aliases.  Added a warning to log
if '/' is prepended to the path for a mapping.
Committed a modified version of a patch to add wildcard support for virtual
host names that begin with '*'. The beginning '*' should only be used with
virtual host aliases.
Submitted by: Chris Bryden

author: larryi
msg: Some updates for 3.3

author: costin
msg: Few fixes in Request, Response: make sure all fields are "protected" ( some were
package ), so it can be extended. Added "deprecated" on some of the really old
methods, and make sure we use getters instead of the fields ( methods could be
overriden ).
This is part of the final review of the APIs, preparing for ( hopefully ) final beta.

author: costin
msg: Added missing support for
<Host name="foo">
<Alias name="bar" />
<Context ... >
This will call ctx.addHostAlias(). Thanks to Larry and Chris for finding this,
I hope it's enough to get the "host wildcard" patch back on track.
I agree with Larry, the "main" host name can't be wildcard, it's also used to
construct the reply ( for example for redirects and to recreate the url ).

author: costin
msg: Same.
